What are the key features of Verus Coin wallet version 0.4.0 and later, and how do they contribute to the security and performance of the Verus Coin network?

The Verus Coin wallet version 0.4.0 and later have several key features that enhance the security and performance of the Verus Coin network. One of the most significant features is the support for Sapling high-performance zero-knowledge transactions. This technology enables fast and secure transactions on the Verus Coin network, which is essential for its overall performance.

In addition to basic Sapling support, version 0.4.0c of the wallet also includes support for Sapling-compatible, transparent mobile transactions. This feature allows for seamless and secure transactions on mobile devices, making it easier for users to interact with the Verus Coin network on-the-go.

Another important feature of version 0.4.0 and later is the support for Stake Guard transactions. This feature helps to ensure the security of the network by preventing selfish staking behavior, which can compromise the integrity of the blockchain.

Furthermore, version 0.4.0c of the wallet includes a powerful "Cheat Catcher" feature. This feature enables miners and stakers to earn money by catching and preventing selfish staking behavior on the network. The "Cheat Catcher" requires a Sapling z-address, which can be added to the CLI wallet using the "-cheatcatcher=zaddress" option or in the Settings->App config of the enhanced Agama GUI.

Overall, the features of Verus Coin wallet version 0.4.0 and later contribute to the security and performance of the Verus Coin network by enabling fast and secure transactions, preventing selfish staking behavior, and incentivizing miners and stakers to maintain the integrity of the blockchain.
